event.name: AUGMENTED_ANOINTED

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the augmented leader, the Anointed.

event.text: You've arrived at the exit...
A white Lanius with purple details stands up from her large throne as soon as you arrive.
"You are Federation ship I hear about. I understand you have brought with you one of ancient creatures. I will buy it from you, modest price."
You wait for the Lanius to come aboard and take the ancient from you. This will likely be the last you see of this great mystery, but you've made a good profit from it.

choice.text: Ask what she intends to use it for first.

event.text: "Food, naturally. My diet, very complicated. Hard to get hands on these, especially live ones. He will make tasty snack, though I would preferred royal to commoner..."

choice.text: Refuse, we aren't going to let this creature eat another living being!

event.text: "So you are turning down offer? Most disappointing. Perhaps price too low for you? I raise it, being fair."
"You really stubborn. Fine, no final offer. You not giving me creature, then I taking it myself!"
You wait for the Lanius to come aboard and take the ancient from you. This will likely be the last you see of this great mystery, but you've made a good profit from it.
You wait for the Lanius to come aboard and take the ancient from you. This will likely be the last you see of this great mystery, but you've made a good profit from it.
Looks like the Anointed's ship is gone now, but the Rebel fleet has taken control of the beacon! You'll have to fight your way out!

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Try to escape the Elite.

event.name: ANOINTED_SURRENDER
event.text: "Ok, you winning. You may keep creature, not worth dying over. Taking this, and leave us here. Apologies for attack."

event.name: ANOINTED_SURRENDER_ACCEPT
event.text: You accept the Anointed's surrender, and she transfers over a good amount of scrap. As you prepare to leave though, she asks to speak with you about one more thing.

The Lanius hands you a strange key-like device. "This ancient, like many other, is in hibernation. This device seeming able to awaken them. There is mystery here, yes? I wishing I could solve it, but you are one now with privileged. You will need this and fuel as catalyst. Good luck."

choice.text: Offer to take her with you.

event.text: "Oh, could not. Sorry, but busy here. My life, very difficult. The material of body very unstable, always needing to feed on more. Without it, I decay, die. Very painful, you understand."

choice.text: Offer her an Ancient Laser to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Beam to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Pinpoint to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Missile Launcher to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Bomb Launcher to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Peacekeeper to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Laser Drone to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Ion Drone to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Missile Drone to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Overwatcher Drone to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Mender to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Director to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Atomizer to feed on.
Offer her an Ancient Atomizer to feed on.

event.name: ANOINTED_DESTROYED
event.text: The Anointed's cruiser explodes. There's plenty left to scrap from the wreckage, but with her dies any chance that you might figure out what to do with this alien.

event.name: ANOINTED_DEADCREW
event.text: The crew of the cruiser has been neutralized. You move in to inspect the ship and collect the remains.

As you inspect the ship, you find the Anointed decaying on the ground. She gestures for you to come closer, and slaps a strange looking device in your hands. She manages to choke out the words: "This is activator key. Along with fuel catalyst, will wake ancient... from h-hibernation. There is great mystery here... my mistake for interrupting. You will solve it, I am sure..." With that, she falls to the ground, dead.

event.name: AUGMENTED_FREESCRAP
event.text: It seems this beacon was once home to an Ancient ship, but has been scrapped down to the core. There is just enough left however for you to get some extra scrap.

event.name: AUGMENTED_ARTIST
event.text: This region of space is very different from its surroundings. Someone has gone through the trouble of turning the shells of the ruins into a nice, long tunnel wide enough for your ship to fly through, rather than leaving the shattered vessels strewn randomly across the system.

As you pilot your ship into the tunnel, you become aware that someone has been drawing on the walls with a strange sticky, particulate substance. The art depicts Lanius alongside ships, strange cubes, and diamonds, and the quality seems to improve as you delve deeper into the tunnel. Eventually, some rudimentary drawings of solar systems enter your view - though the details you can discern seem to refer to systems that haven't existed for eons. Towards the end of the tunnel, you see a picture where a looming black-and-gold figure is shooing away a small group of Augmented, while a crowd of Lanius watches. A larger, purple-and-white figure is cut off by the edge of the mural, leading the outcasts elsewhere.

You come upon the most recent string of paintings deep within the tunnel, where an Augmented is finishing up a portrait of the purple and white figure you saw before. It looks almost impressionistic, a glow radiating off of the wall. The Lanius finally notices your ship and pushes off the wall to land on your hull.
"Outsider. Make what see. Other Lanius not understand. You are not seen. Not known. Can make image?"

choice.text: (Human Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Human.

event.text: You send your human to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Fleshy... with strands on head... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your human feels that the depiction looks like a few strands of bacon with a brush for a head. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Engi.

event.text: You send your Engi to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Metallic... hunched... focused... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Despite this, your Engi seems fine with the depiction, noting that it sees the resemblance. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Zoltan.

event.text: You send your Zoltan to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Glowy... small... transparent... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Zoltan feels that the depiction looks like a burnt out L.E.D. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Orchid.

event.text: You send your Orchid to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Flimsy... colorful... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Orchid feels it looks like an piece of origami taped to a garden hose. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Shell Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Shell.

event.text: You send your Shell to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Round... slimy... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Shell feels it looks like a muddy old tire. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Mantis.

event.text: You send your Mantis to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Sharp... crawly... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Mantis feels it looks like a treadmill made of swords, which means they like it. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Rockman.

event.text: You send your Rock to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Big... Rough... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Rock feels it looks like a misshapen potato. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Slug.

event.text: You send your Slug to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Fat... Slimy... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Slug feels it looks like a bratwurst with a propeller cap. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Leech Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Leech.

event.text: You send your Leech to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Long... Thin... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Leech feels it looks like a ruined slinky. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Spider Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Giant Alien Spider.

event.text: You send your Spider to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Many legs... many eyes... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Spider doesn't even seem to realize what's going on. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Equinoid Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Equinoid.

event.text: You send your Equinoid to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Many legs... Colorful... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Equinoid doesn't even seem to realize what's going on. The artist is satisfied.

You have Wealsey perch in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Small... Light... Majestic... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very familiar. In fact, it looks surprisingly similar to the Rebel MFK logo. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Lizard Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Lizard.

event.text: You send your Lizard to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. The Lanius seems at a loss for words, but nods. It jumps to a wall and begins drawing. The Lanius draws the Lizard with almost perfect accuracy. The Lizard nods in satisfaction. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Morph Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Morph.

event.text: You send your Morph to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Doughy... dull colors... Got inspiration!" The Lanius jumps to a wall and begins drawing. Although the Lanius has developed some skill, the depiction looks very... odd. Your Morph momentarily adjusts its shape to match the drawing. The artist is satisfied.

choice.text: (Siren Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Siren.

event.text: You send your Siren to stand in front of the window for the Augmented to see. "New creature! Haven't seen! Can't... Think...!" The Lanius grabs its head, as if in pain before it starts drawing. But instead of drawing the Siren, it draws a picture of what looks like a dead Slug and some broken circles. The artist looks woozy and passes out.
With the Lanius unconscious, the best you can do is take whatever scrap you can find lying around.

choice.text: (Eldritch Crew) Let the Lanius sketch an Eldritch creature.

event.text: You let the Lanius see your eldritch crew. Upon seeing them, the Augmented claps. "The inspiration! It flows freely!" The artist jumps to a wall and begins drawing. For some reason, the Lanius has made what looks like a children's picture book on the wall, full of simple rhymes and goofy animal characters. The art is very tasteful.

choice.text: (Obelisk Crew) Let the Lanius sketch your Ancient crewmember.

event.text: "You!! Anointed wants!" The Lanius looks like it's about to attack... but then pauses. "Not fighter. Can't take. Will sketch." The Lanius sketches the Ancient crewmember. It comes out looking pretty good.
"Anointed warn us. You go." The Lanius stares at your ship, then scurries into a room, coming back with a gift. "Then take. But go."
"Very sad. Need inspiration." The Lanius hops off your ship and resumes painting. All that's left to do is to leave the tunnel.
You exercise discretion and leave the tunnel alone.

event.name: AUGMENTED_ARTIST_REWARD
event.text: "Friendly creature! Will continue depicting! Have present. Not need weapon when have art."

event.name: AUGMENTED_HUNGRY
event.text: A small shuttle flies past, carrying a single augmented Lanius. They hail you, pleading for a favor. "My body, it decomposing fast. Need to eat hull to live. This shuttle small, begging you let take small bite of yours. Nothing you can't managing."

The Lanius flies the shuttle close and exits out the bottom, gliding its way onto yours. He attaches and begins to liquify a small portion of the hull. It's barely anything, much less than you expected, but the Lanius is grateful and even offers to join your crew.
You refuse. The Lanius looks frightened, but not for long before their arms fall off and they melt into a puddle of metal. Guess when he said fast, he meant very fast...

event.name: AUGMENTED_WAYSTONE
event.text: This sector is home to all kinds of weird sights, and now you can add Crystal Elites to your list of unexpected visitors you didn't think you'd see in this sector.

The Crystal Sentinels are equally surprised to see a Federation ship here, but they regard you in at least a decently passive way. "We've come looking for several parts from these structures. We believe their tech was combined with that of our ancestors to create the waystone that sealed away our homeworlds. However, navigating this sector is difficult. If you happen to have any map data, we'll gladly take it."

choice.text: Sell them whatever basic data you've already collected.
(Adv. Navigation) Sell them the data your navigator has picked up.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Sell them the data your scanners have collected.
(Adv. Sensors) Sell them the data your sensors have collected.

event.text: In true barbarian fashion, you prove that you love nothing more than to attack first and ask questions later. You attack the Crystalline vessel without mercy.
The Crystals spend some time exploring two nearby wrecks before jumping away. You figure if they didn't find anything, you won't either.

event.name: AUGMENTED_FEEDING
event.text: Nearby is a small ancient ruin with some augmented Lanius feeding on it. As you approach, they hail you. "You visitor? If having any fellow Lanius, feel free join in. Enough here to change composition!"

choice.text: (Lanius Crew) Let your Lanius feed on the ruins.

event.text: Your Lanius glides out of the ship towards the ruins and attaches to them along with the others...
You watch in fascination as your Lanius's metal body slowly turns dark black. Soon they return, looking the same as all the other augmented Lanius you've seen, and with the same abilities too.

choice.text: Your Augmented crew would not gain any benefit from these ruins, as they've already undergone substantial transformation from feeding on similar salvage.
Attack them to access the ruins on your own!

event.text: You move closer, firing on the Lanius. They detach from the structure, allowing you to move in and salvage it. However, they aren't deterred long enough, and they re-attach themselves to the hull and break their way in!
The Lanius make no further attempts at contacting you.
You power up your weapons and fight the Augmented ship.
You decide not to fight the Lanius, and fly away.

textList.name: TEXT_AUGMENTED_CHOICE
textList.text: The Augmented might not always be the friendliest, but the ship here makes no move to fight you. Will you do the same?
"Am warning you avoid. My ship dangerous, you wanting not to mess with." The Lanius on the other ship sticks out his chest in pride and waves his sharp blades boastfully.
A Lanius trying to avoid conflict with a military ship isn't all too uncommon, but you've seen some particularly savage Augmented ships. Still, the vessel here makes no aggressive moves.
At first you aren't certain if the Lanius ship in front of you is still active, but scans turn back faint life signs. Not injured, just asleep. Do you wish to take advantage of this situation?

event.name: AUGMENTED_LANIUS
event.text: It seems tensions have gotten high between the nearby augmented and elite Lanius vessel over possession of some ancient wreckage. Do you want to get involved?
You power up your weapons and fight the elite ship.
You power up your weapons and fight the augmented ship.
You decide not to interact with the Lanius, and fly away.

event.name: AUGMENTED_GHOST
event.text: The Ancient vessel nearby is in much better condition than usual, but that's not the only thing off about it... scans show Vagabonds have taken control of the ship!

choice.text: Attack them, maybe the ship has something of value!

event.text: The Vagabonds, determined not to give up their ship, prepare to defend themselves against your attack.

choice.text: Hail the Vagabonds and offer to trade.

event.text: You send your message and wait for a response, knowing your translator needs some time to properly decipher the static noises of the Ghosts. "Hello, you are acknowledged. We have recovered this new vessel, but we lack the resources required for its upkeep. If you have generous amounts of fuel, we will accept an exchange of goods."

choice.text: Give them a small amount of fuel.

event.text: "This is a quantifiable amount of fuel, but only barely. I hope you did not expect payment higher than this."

choice.text: Give them a medium amount of fuel.

event.text: "This will service well. Thank you."

choice.text: Give them a large amount of fuel.

event.text: "This is a large quantity of fuel. You have our highest appreciation. Please accept this piece of armament, it belonged to the former residents of this ship, whoever they might have been."
You wait for any further response from the Vagabonds, but get none. You pull away from the Ancient ship and leave the Ghosts behind.
If the Vagabonds have managed to secure an Ancient ship, good for them. That's not a band of gas beings you want to deal with.

event.name: AUGMENTED_SEPARATISTS
event.text: A lone Engi Separatist is scanning a long abandoned ancient vessel. When you jump in, they put some distance between your ships, but don't leave.
"Local Federation vessel, we [assure] you that you have been detected. Please do not interfere, we are searching for ways to [disable] the Harmony."

The Separatist lets out an audible sigh. "The [cubical] vessels that populate this sector belonged to ancient race. It is believed, though 60% speculation, that these creatures first developed Harmony. There is your [lore], now please leave."

choice.text: Attack them, maybe they have something valuable on board!

event.text: You've decided to attack the Separatist ship. Prepare for battle.

choice.text: Do what they say and leave them alone.

event.text: The ship isn't bothering you, so you won't bother them either.

choice.text: (Separatist Crew) "Your mission is of [high] importance. However, so is ours. Requesting: supplies."

event.text: Your Separatist explains your mission to the other Engi. "This request is acceptable. Transferring supplies now."

choice.text: (Engi Crew) "This is unacceptable. Preventing Separatist success is highest priority."

event.text: Your Engi demands that you take care of the Separatists before they can complete their mission.

choice.text: Do what they say and leave them alone.

event.text: The ship isn't bothering you, so you won't bother them either.
You'll be damned if you let some Engi run away from you. You'll solve this the only way you know - with needless murder.
The ship isn't bothering you, so you won't bother them either.

event.name: AUGMENTED_INQUISITION
event.text: Here you've found perhaps the last thing you would have thought to see, an abandoned Inquisition vessel. The Elders must have sent this scout here to press their influence even further, or perhaps they know more than you do...
The Rock vessel remains motionless while you fly away.
Nothing disturbs you while you scrap the ship. It appears the Lanius must have done some serious damage to their life support, and even the resistant Crusaders couldn't save themselves.

While salvaging the ship, several Rockmen Crusaders suddenly bust in through the door. "No one expects the Rock Inquisition!" Whether it was an ambush or they just really don't like you, it doesn't matter anymore. Prepare for combat!

Scans show the ship is empty. It appears the Lanius must have done some serious damage to their life support, and even the resistant Crusaders couldn't save themselves. You decide it's safe to salvage.
Scans show the life support on the ship has taken some damage, but the Crusader crew is still aboard.
You raise the weapons and attack the Crusader vessel while their oxygen is offline!

The Crusaders are surprisingly receptive to your questions. "We heard this sector contained relics of an ancient god race, which matched some ancient Crystal mythology. The Elders don't want any challengers to the Crystal race, so they sent us out here to capture one and bring it back... only to find a bunch of Lanius who wanted to eat us. Now if you'll excuse us, we have to get back to repairing this ship before we suffocate and die."
You raise the weapons and attack the Crusader vessel while their oxygen is offline!

choice.text: (Upg. Oxygen) Offer to dock and refill their oxygen.

event.text: The Crusaders agree, and you quickly dock with their ship and flood it with oxygen. They're considerably pleased, and while most of them feel the need to carry on with their mission, one wishes to stay behind with you, to which the others don't protest.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUGMENTED_EXPLOSIVE
event.text: An Augmented ship frantically contacts you. "Hurry! Ruin explode! Need act quick for eat!" There is a nearby piece of old technology that is flashing and heating up.

choice.text: (Hacking) Hack into the tech to stop the explosion.

event.text: Fortunately, you are able to diagnose and address the problem - a self-destruct had been tripped, likely by the Augmented ship. With the self-destruct disabled, your ship and the Lanius are able to convene over the ruin.

choice.text: (Hacking Weapon) Attempt to stop the explosion.

event.text: You fire your weapon, and after a moment the tech begins to cool down. Seems a self-destruct had been tripped, likely by the Augmented ship. With the self-destruct disabled, your ship and the Lanius are able to convene over the ruin.
You fire your weapon, but nothing happens. You beat a hasty retreat while the tech continues to heat to critical levels.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUGMENTED_EXPLOSIVE_HACK
event.text: The Augmented ship flies over to inspect. "Good job. Share in ruin. Half, half." Even just half of the bounty is a high yield - you are able to get quite a lot of scrap out of it.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUGMENTED_EXPLOSIVE_FAIL
event.text: The Augmented ship quickly flies away from the wreckage as it explodes. It then confronts you - "Our meal, gone. We eat your ship!"

event.name: DISTRESS_AUGMENTED_WENTWORTH
event.text: The distress signal originates from a disabled Wentworth Industries Auto-scout. Before you can investigate further, you receive a hail from a nearby Augmented vessel: "Found ship. Claim ship. Not give. But, had weird thing, hurts to touch. Can't eat. Don't want. Promise to leave alone, you take?"
The Lanius detaches the technology from the ship: a Sentry weapon. Whatever allowed a Wentworth Industries scout to come into the sector can't be good, but at least it's being destroyed.

choice.text: We will be taking the whole wreck. Power up weapons.

event.text: The moment you start your weapons, you are immediately boarded by a raiding party. However, the ship is undefended, meaning you can freely take the weapon once the boarders are dealt with.
The moment you start your weapons, the Augmented ship comes online. They intend to defend their harvest!

The moment you start your weapons, you are immediately boarded by a raiding party. To make matters worse, the Auto-ship starts up again. "Reinitialization: complete. Renegade detected. Hostile Lanius detected. New mission parameters: Eliminate all targets." It looks like they weren't done with disabling it!

event.name: AUGMENTED_WENTWORTH_SCRAP
event.text: With the ship deactivated, it is safe to scrap.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUGMENTED_NEAR_DEATH
event.text: "Help. Help. Falling life! Hull critical! Destruction imminent!" The Augmented are frantically translating their SOS as fast as they can.
The medical bomb restores the Augmented to full fitness, and they quickly calm down. "In fight. Won, barely. Have - we found this."

choice.text: (Repair Burst) Repair their ship with a repair bomb. [-1}]

event.text: The repair bomb repairs the Lanius vessel, giving them the capability to fix themselves using the hull - after which, they calm down. "In fight. Won, barely. Have - we found this."

choice.text: (Hull Repair Drone) Repair their ship with a drone. [-1|]

event.text: The drone repairs the Lanius vessel, giving them the capability to fix themselves using the hull - after which, they calm down. "In fight. Won, barely. Have - we found this."

choice.text: (Medical Crew) Have your medical crew help them out.

event.text: It's a little awkward to help them out, given that your medical crew breathes the oxygen that the Lanius deplete, but they do their best from the safety of their shuttle. Your crew returns with a gift from the rescued vessel.

choice.text: (Repair Arm) Use your repair arm to patch them up. [-25~]

event.text: Your repair arm manages to fix their ship, giving the Lanius the capability to fix themselves using the hull - after which, they calm down. "In fight. Won, barely. Have - we found this."
The ship goes dark. Surprisingly, they have all chosen to die of starvation instead of destroying their own ship.

You swiftly contact the Lanius and instruct them to lower their shields so you can use your Beam to fix their integrity. They do so, allowing themselves to be repaired, and they calm down afterwards. "In fight. Won, barely. Have - we found this."

You swiftly contact the Lanius and instruct them to lower their shields so you can use your Beam to fix their integrity. However, your plea goes ignored - either due to mistrust or confusion, which is not helped by their panic.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUGMENTED_NEAR_DEATH_EXPLOSION
event.text: You watch as the Augmented have to pick between hunger and destruction. Unsurprisingly, one of them cracks and eats their hull, compromising its integrity.

event.name: QUEST_AUGMENTED_AUTOMATED_SIGNAL
event.text: An ancient communication receiver resides here, picking up a garbled signal from a different system. Unfortunately, it is in the language of the species that created it.

The communication originates from a nearby system. An Auto-ship is transmitting a message about a ruin that drifted into a Pulsar. You can likely find some valuable salvage there, but the Auto-ship will likely attack whoever manages to get close to the ruin.

The communication originates from a nearby system. An Auto-ship is transmitting a message about a ruin that drifted into a Pulsar. You can likely find some valuable salvage there, but the Auto-ship will likely attack whoever manages to get close to the ruin.
You leave the signal alone to focus on other things.

event.name: AUGMENTED_AUTOMATED_SIGNAL_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An Ancient Auto-Ship is protecting a ruin at this beacon.

event.text: The Auto-ship orbits the Pulsar, activating as soon as you jump in. You'll have to fight it in order to gain access to the ruin!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUGMENTED
textList.text: The Augmented are fearsome fighters and scavengers, even if you've met a few friendly ones too. It appears you've met one that is far less friendly, and they're looking to attack you!
It appears the drive for life-sustaining scrap has driven the nearby Augmented Lanius to madness, and they're desperate enough to attack a military vessel like yours!
You didn't think the Lanius could get any more scrap-hungry than the ones in the Swarmlands, but the Augmented have proven otherwise. Prepare for battle!
"Needing scrap. You have ship made of scrap. I eat you ship. Do not worrying, am fair. Will give you shuttle." This won't fly for as long as you are captain of this ship!
You knew the Augmented come here to feed on ancient wreckage, but you didn't know they'd go so far as to attack a ship like yours!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUGMENTED_LANIUS
textList.text: This sector might be primarily run by the Augmented Lanius, but that doesn't mean it isn't possible to find regular Lanius lying in wait to prey on passing ships, such as the one here that's firing in your direction.
You might have been surprised by seeing a hostile Lanius ship here, but the Augmented have to come from somewhere, you suppose.
This ship here might be no Augmented vessel, but it is a regular Lanius, and they're as hungry for your ship as anywhere else!
You briefly hope you might be able to reason with the approaching Lanius ship, but alas it appears it's too late for words, only violence.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AUGMENTED_AUTOANCIENT
event.text: Another automated ship similar to the one you saw has managed to survive the Lanius swarm in this sector. As soon as you approach, it seems to recognize you as a threat and attacks!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AUGMENTED_PIRATE
event.text: You receive a hail from a pirate ship, but on the other line you hear nothing but loud screaming as an augmented Lanius cuts open the pirate captain and devours him. "Apologies for witnessing. Need food. You next."

event.name: AUGMENTED_DISCOVERY

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: These are the coordinates you found at the Harmony Link.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've arrived at the coords marked on your map. You notice the remains of some much smaller but similar cubical ships as before. The main difference from last time however, other than location, is three massive Lanius vessels in colors you've never seen before.

You hail the ships, but receive no verbal response. Instead, a strangely colored Lanius pops out of their hull, and glides towards you. It attaches to your hull, and burrows its way through, but the damage shouldn't be too hard to patch up quickly.
The Lanius unfolds, spitting out some metal. It speaks in a monotone but strangely well-translated voice. "Apologies damage. Not wanting take airlocks, my bad. You call me, assuming question have?"

The strange Lanius inspects the robot before speaking. "No, not robot. Lifeform, like you. Metal, like me. Showing this to leader, best option. She wanting see this, rare find one alive! Allowing me to assist FTL drive?"

choice.text: Agree to let him "assist the FTL Drive".
